title: How does temp change in cycle

content.question: An ideal gas is taken through the cycle shown on the above graph of pressure <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of volume <math alttext="V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Process <math alttext="A B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is isothermal. Which of the following correctly describes the change in the temperature of the gas as it is taken from state <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to state <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and then to state <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>DecreasesIncreases

<math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>DecreasesDecreases

<math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>IncreasesIncreases

<math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>IncreasesDecreases

content.answer: <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>C</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>DecreasesIncreases

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
